Articles.Content:
Well, this is it. The big test. Well, at least the first one. I\'m likely going to take it again in May.

My PSAT last year was a 181, this year a 195, and my latest practice test was an estimated 1920. They did not give me the 1600 scale score. My weakest part is apparently math... I think I get a bit OCD over my answers and then end up checking and re-checking too much. I didn\'t finish the math on the Practice test nor the PSAT. Reading I did very well though, over 700 estimated, and the essay was pretty average.

I\'m hoping for above 2000. Preferably in the 2100\'s or even 2200\'s. On the 1600 scale, 1500 and above or bust.

Anyone else taking them tomorrow (If you\'re not in the U.S., you do not have them at all)? If so, what do you think your weaknesses/strengths are? Goals?
Good luck. I may be a middle-schooler, but I understand big tests. (I was pitted against Canada\'s best in a Bible contest, and won a school-wide Israel Contest.)

I am in 7th grade, but I took the Duke University SAT back in December. They have a program for it. Anyway, it was quite the tree destroyer, there were more pages than the TAKS test I had taken the previous year, and it is still bigger than the STAAR (the new test of Texas). You however, seem to have quite the SAT experience and I applaud your efforts. Good luck

Best of luck to you sir! Given that you\'re here out of all the places on the internet, I imagine you\'ll do fine. =P

I never messed around with the SATs much, I ended up doing well enough on the ACT to get into school. Oddly

enough, the subject I struggled with the most was math, which also happens to be my major. Derp.

And remember to try and not second-guess yourself, for that is the path to destruction... Or low scores...

It was definitely one of the two, but I forget which...
Read the question twice, answer once, not the other way round.

Well, they\'re over. I managed to finish all the sections with time to spare in each one, so I was able to go back and make sure I didn\'t make a stupid.

I think I did really well, I\'d be very surprised at anything under 2000. Woo!

I thought you meant SATS, and I thought \'aren\'t those being phased out\'?

I was thinking of the wrong continent, and I added a letter.
